images.description: Black Tesla Model S for main vehicle status display

images.usage: Battery health card background or icon

accessibility.contrast: Ensure 4.5:1 contrast ratio for text. Use lighter greys (#A1A1AA) on dark backgrounds, never dark grey.
accessibility.aria_labels: Required for all icon-only buttons and charts

universal_guidelines.component_style: Functional components with prop-types (optional) or standard props
universal_guidelines.testing: All interactive elements MUST include data-testid attribute (e.g., data-testid='vehicle-selector')
universal_guidelines.transparency: Avoid pure transparent backgrounds on overlays. Use bg-black/80 or backdrop-blur.
universal_guidelines.charts: Use Recharts or Chart.js with custom dark theme colors. Axis lines should be subtle (#333).
universal_guidelines.state_management: Zustand stores should be modular (useVehicleStore, useDiagnosticsStore).

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the dashboard using a high-density bento grid layout.
Use the provided Tesla Model S image as the central 'Vehicle Status' visualization.
Create a 'VehicleSelector' component using Shadcn Select (customized for dark mode).
Simulate real-time data updates (speed, battery, temp) every 3 seconds using `setInterval` in a useEffect or Zustand middleware.
Ensure all text is legible on the dark background. Avoid dark blue text on black.
Use 'Barlow' font for headings to give it that automotive/technical feel. Add it via Google Fonts in index.html.
For the Battery Health chart, use a Line Chart with a gradient fill (green to transparent).
For Tire Pressure, visualize 4 values around a car silhouette (use the hero image or a simple CSS shape).
Do not use TypeScript syntax (interfaces, types) as the project is .js.
